intro: Thysanocarpus emarginatus, commonly known as the narrow-leafed thysanocarp, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested or swampy areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
